quest.name: Waiting for Gyodo
journal:
Gyoshin is more eager to speak with you than ever before.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Though─by some estimates─the number of festival participants has ballooned, Gyoshin continues to be troubled by ominous premonitions, and is convinced that the festival in its current state will not suffice to ward off the Namazu's eventual doom. At the suggestion of Seigetsu the Enlightened, the Namazu decide to make the Hingan custom of mikoshi parades their own. You do some warm-up stretches and prepare to lug Gyoshin to Kugane for a research excursion.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Mere moments after you arrive in Kugane and liberate Gyoshin from your bag, you are beset by a group of angry shipwrights who have mistaken him for Gyodo, an unsavory character with whom you are unfortunately well acquainted. You hastily defuse the situation before it comes to blows, and, in a stroke of luck, the lead shipwright reveals himself a builder and enthusiast of mikoshi.

The shipwright not only explains the significance of mikoshi as portable abodes for the kami, but also provides diagrams detailing their construction. Gyoshin is excited to get started, but nevertheless opts to waddle back to the Azim Steppe rather than brave the bag once more.

As soon as you arrive back at Dhoro Iloh, Gyoshin, already envisioning a magnificent completed mikoshi, tasks you with providing frippery. Gyorei will again be collecting all project components to avoid any mishaps.

With your assistance, Gyorei assembles all the components a mikoshi could possibly need, and, working together with the Namazu, you complete one. The preparations for the parade are finally complete, and Gyoshin seems adamant that you be there─though he has not yet revealed what role he expects you to play.

Gyoshin explains that you must excite the attendees by giving a festive shout as you ride by them on the mikoshi. Some trepidation at the thought of being whisked across the festival grounds by a team of Namazu with questionable coordination is understandable, but at least you will not be too far from the ground if you fall.

※Speak with Gyoshin in Dhoro Iloh to summon the mikoshi bearers.
Faithfully following Gyoshin's instructions, you balance precariously atop the mikoshi and call out “Wasshoi!” to excited onlookers, who are more than happy to “Wasshoi!” back at you.

Gyoshin is so excited by the success of the parade that he resolves to build an additional float, and proceeds to do so faster than the blink of an eye. Gaze upon this feat of craftsmanship, and let it inspire you to make the Namazu's event bigger and better.
objectives: Travel to Kugane and deposit Gyoshin at the destination.
Speak to Gyoshin at Dhoro Iloh.
Synthesize [Error]Deliver [Error] to GyoreiMine [Error] northeast of the Dawn ThroneGather [Error] northeast of the Dawn ThroneCatch [Error] at Azim Khaat.
Ride the mikoshi to nearby Namazu spectators and use Wasshoi to excite and delight them.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Forename, Forename! There is something I wish to discuss. Wait here while I gather the others.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Our joint efforts have borne fruit, and more and more Namazu come from Yanxia to join us every day. We are surely nearing seven hundred seventy-seven participants by now. Yes, yes... Though I admit I lost track after nine. I only have so many fins and whiskers to count with, you know.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Alas, my sleep remains troubled. Restless. Every night, I dream of nothing but the Big One.

dialogue.name: GYOREI
dialogue.text: My, my, is the Big One so unsatisfied with our offerings?

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: I wish I knew. Perhaps an offering in and of itself does not a festival make. If we had the wrong idea, then, then...

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: ...We will die in seven years. Seven years!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Please at least feign distress over our plight!

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: Gyoshin's absurd night terrors notwithstanding, he is right in that an offering does not constitute a festival. The addition of a ceremony with more cultural aspects would not go amiss.

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: True, primitive festivals were not particularly artistic endeavors. But from their base origins did they evolve. Prayer transformed to divination, and ritual to spectacle.

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: Thus did the shaman become ever more significant to society, and come to wield power similar to that of a chieftain or king. And these shamans, in turn, imbued festivals with yet more ostentation─the better to catch the public eye, you see.

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: Ceremonial accoutrements became ever more elaborate, while the scale of the events expanded exponentially. This series of escalations culminated in the development of extravagant festival processions!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: ...Summarize your suggestion. Briefly. Three sentences or less.

dialogue.name: KOFUINSEIGETSU
dialogue.text: <sigh> Per The Chrysanthemum and the Dango, some festivals in Hingashi are known for their parades. These parades involve carrying objects called mikoshi. We should attempt to imitate them.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: See, you can do it if you try. If you expend the effort. Now do that from the start next time.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: So, so, Forename! You recall how I am most portable, yes, yes? I must away to Kugane, to see a mikoshi and its construction firsthand. Go ahead and stuff me in your bag again, if you please.

dialogue.name: GYOREI
dialogue.text: You take care, now. Yes, yes.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: <wheeze> That bag is most full of sharp objects. And quite cluttered. I can hardly believe I escaped that rubbish-packed purgatory alive.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: ...I did not intend to say that out loud. No, no. What I meant was, “thank you!” Yes, yes, of course.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: So, this is Kugane! The vivid colors, the brilliant hues! My artistic soul is all astir!

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Oi, ye Namazu bastard! Mighty lovely to see ye here. Now prepare fer a beatin'!

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: Thought ye'd run off with me money, did ye? Well ye won't be runnin' nowhere when I'm through with ye!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: W-Wait, wait! Who are you and why, why are you yelling?

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: Don't go playin' silly buggers with me! Ye owe me fer a ship. If I ain't seein' no coin from ye, I'll take it outta yer hide!

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: Eh? This here's “Gyoshin,” not that swindler Gyodo?

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: Well blow me down! My mistake, little fish fella.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: I am just relieved that this was resolved without “beatin'.” I would much prefer to view the mikoshi with my hide intact. Yes, yes.

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: Yer interested in mikoshi? A Namazu after me own heart!

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: Ye might not have heard, but it's shipwrights like us what build mikoshi here in Kugane. I'd hate to leave ye with a bad impression, so how 'bout I teach ye what I know by way of apology?

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: I would be most delighted! Very pleased!

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: Just head on over to the ol' Ofunakura, then, and I'll show ye everything there is to know.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: I never imagined we would receive instruction in mikoshi-crafting so soon after arriving in Kugane. No, no. How fortunate that I was nearly murdered!

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: Alright, so what ye need to know first is that mikoshi are meant to be carriages fer the kami. 'Course kami usually reside in shrines, where we earthly folk go to pray, but they also feel right at home in mikoshi. Which means mikoshi are basically small shrines, ye ken?

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: And since we carry 'em for festival parades, they need to be portable. So we attach some poles, and there ye have it─a proper mikoshi.

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: Now, Namazu like yerself have a short reach. And are all...round, like. So ye'll need to put some thought into what ye should attach to yer mikoshi to make it easy to carry.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: I see. This has been quite informative. Most enlightening.

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: I'll give ye this diagram as well, so go out there and build the best mikoshi yer little flippers can manage.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: I love diagrams! Am most fond of design documents, indeed. Let us return to Dhoro Iloh posthaste. I will walk this time... Not to cast any aspersions on the state of your bag, no, no.

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT
dialogue.text: I suppose I'll head back to searchin' for that Gyodo now. But I'll make sure I've got the right Namazu afore I go a-pummelin'.

dialogue.name: GYOREI
dialogue.text: I do hope your journey to Kugane was educational. Yes, yes.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: I have meditated on how to build a mikoshi suitable for Namazu needs.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: It will require some complex adjustments, some tricky alterations, but nothing my deft fins cannot handle.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Now, I need you to make some mikoshi pieces. They must be extravagant. Most fancy! The materials you need should be in the crate by the pavilion, so just throw some together. Carefully.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Now, I need you to make some mikoshi pieces. They must be extravagant. Most fancy! The materials you need should be in the crate by the pavilion, so just throw some together. Carefully.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Now, I need you to make some components for the finishing touches. Colorful paints, yes, yes. The materials should be in the chest by the pavilion, so just whip some up. Slowly, so as not to splatter.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Now, I need you to fetch me some dawn dust for the ornamentation. You will find deposits northeast of the Dawn Throne. Yes, yes. Try not to get any in your eye! It is quite painful, I can personally attest.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Now, I need you to fetch me some duskglow cocoons for the ceremonial rope. You should find a few in the vegetation patches northeast of the Dawn Throne. Yes, yes. Watch out for jutting twigs! They are most unpleasant when encountered face-first, I can personally attest.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Now, I need you to fetch me a water fan for decoration. You can catch them in Azim Khaat, so long as you have salmon roe to lure them. Yes, yes. Take care not to fall in! It is surprisingly easy to do, I can personally attest.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Gyorei will collect the components. Yes, yes. We will commence assembly once everything is in her capable fins.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: There should be extra materials in the crate. Rummage through as you please.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: There should be extra materials in the crate. Rummage through as you please.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: There should be extra materials in the crate. Rummage through as you please.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Gyorei will collect the components, yes, yes. And then we will assemble the mikoshi!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Gyorei will collect the components, yes, yes. And then we will assemble the mikoshi!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Gyorei will collect the components, yes, yes. And then we will assemble the mikoshi!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You sift through the cornucopia of crafting materials and retrieve all you require for your work.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You sift through the cornucopia of crafting materials and retrieve all you require for your work.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You sift through the cornucopia of crafting materials and retrieve all you require for your work.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: This will make for a most magnificent, fabulously fancy mikoshi! Now if you could just walk three ilms that way and speak to Gyorei, she will add your work to our growing stock.

dialogue.name: GYOREI
dialogue.text: I hope Gyoshin's task gave you no trouble. He does tend toward the unreasonable. Yes, yes. That said, I am excited to see the finished product!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Yes, yes! Our work is complete. A magnificent mikoshi, fit for the Big One!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Shining at the top is our greatest grandsire, as I saw him in my vision. I have included several deeply significant, most meaningful bells to emphasize his importance.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: I also added cloudsbreath to the shrine so that it will float atop the shoulders of even the roundest individuals. Yes, yes.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: It is time to begin the parade! But we will not start without you. No, no. We will commence once you are ready. When you tell me you are prepared.

dialogue.name: GYOREI
dialogue.text: Why, the mikoshi is so beautiful I cannot bear to look away! How fortunate that I do not blink.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: You are ready?

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: According to that violent yet helpful shipwright, in some regions a participant is appointed to ride the mikoshi and represent the kami. We would be honored if you accepted this role!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Guide the bearers around the festival grounds, and make sure to cheer “wasshoi” as loud as you can in front of the onlookers. Or just sneeze with gusto─I find the effect is quite similar, yes, yes. Let me know how it goes!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: I will summon the bearers again. Take care not to tumble off like a sack of Gyorin's increasingly ripe persimmons!

dialogue.name: NAMAZUSIGHTSEER
dialogue.text: What in the world is that?

dialogue.name: NAMAZUSIGHTSEERB
dialogue.text: So then I said, “that's what you get for not checking the jar before you climb inside it,” yes, yes...

dialogue.name: GYOREI
dialogue.text: So many Namazu are volunteering to carry the mikoshi! I wonder if we can cram them all in...

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: Wasshoi! Wasshoi! Wassh─ Ow! I think I pulled something...

dialogue.name: GYOREI
dialogue.text: Oh dear. This is what happens when he gets overexcited. Forename, please go and entertain the attendees while I deal with this.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Namazu are waiting to witness a sensational spectacle. Speak with Gyoshin to mount the mikoshi, and perform a rousing Wasshoi before the Namazu spectators.

dialogue.name: NAMAZUSIGHTSEER
dialogue.text: Wasshoi! Wasshoi! What am I doing? I do not know! I do not care! Whee!

dialogue.name: NAMAZUSIGHTSEER
dialogue.text: We must have a turn holding that wasshoi hut! Onward!

dialogue.name: NAMAZUSIGHTSEERB
dialogue.text: Whoa! Wasshoi! Wasshoi! How exciting!

dialogue.name: NAMAZUSIGHTSEERB
dialogue.text: I want to carry the...whatever it is! Right now! Immediately!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: That was an inspiring sight! Most captivating. I myself felt a strong urge to join the mikoshi bearers, yes, yes, but Gyorei advised I channel my passion into crafting─for the safety of all involved.

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: That is when I remembered that the designs from Kugane included plans for a “float.” There is no better outlet for my inspiration, no, no!

dialogue.name: GYOSHIN
dialogue.text: ...Which is to say that I am about to build a float right now. Watch me. And do not blink!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Working side by side with the Namazu, you have completed the mikoshi. ...And a float! Parades honoring the Big One are underway.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In seven years, there was fated to be a violent feud between Namazu factions over the right to use prime fishing spots along the One River. Many would have died.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: However, carrying the mikoshi together in frequent parades over the course of seven years will bring the Namazu closer together, forging unbreakable bonds between clansmen.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Unbeknownst to all, the Namazu will be spared the grievous tragedy that could have consumed them, and their fate continues to change for the better.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have achieved Respected reputation with the Seven Hundred Seventy-Seven.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New Namazu tribal daily quests are now available from Seigetsu the Enlightened at Dhoro Iloh.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, you will be able to undertake three additional quests from Seigetsu the Enlightened as a reputation bonus. This bonus is available until the daily reset time for tribal quests.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These additional quests will become available after accepting all current daily quests from Seigetsu the Enlightened. Please be advised that you cannot undertake these quests if you have no remaining allowances.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to a wider selection of wares from Gyosho.
